Understate: The claim understates the fact that a negative COVID-19 test does not fully "clear" individuals to go to a gathering.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to back up the assertion that a negative COVID-19 test will clear people to go to holiday gatherings.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that a negative COVID-19 test is sufficient to ensure safety at holiday gatherings, which is a problematic assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim overlooks the alternative explanation that individuals can still get infected after their test or receive a false negative result, undermining the idea that a negative test clears them to attend gatherings.
